alert.note: Alert for Grand (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 13 at 5:12PM MDT until July 13 at 7:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHERN GRAND COUNTY... At 512 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.3 and 0.6 inches may have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... the East Troublesome burn area in Northern Grand County, including Highway 125 This includes the following additional locations... Upper Willow Creek Valley and Middle Willow Creek Valley. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Heavy Rainfall will cause flash flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the East Troublesome burn area. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected across rural roads.
